intro: Anuragia griffithii, commonly known as the Kashmir saffron, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it has a short, herbaceous stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
